comment.text: Mediates both influx and efflux of nucleosides across the membrane (equilibrative transporter). It is sensitive (ES) to low concentrations of the inhibitor nitrobenzylmercaptopurine riboside (NBMPR) and is sodium-independent. It has a higher affinity for adenosine. Inhibited by dipyridamole and dilazep (anticancer chemotherapeutics drugs).

kinetics.text: Vmax for adenosine uptake is about the same for SLC29A1 and SLC29A2.

comment.text: Identified in a complex with STOM.
Predominantly localized in the basolateral membrane in polarized MDCK cells.
Detected in erythrocytes (at protein level). Expressed in heart, brain, mammary gland, erythrocytes and placenta, and also in fetal liver and spleen.
Belongs to the SLC29A/ENT transporter (TC 2.A.57) family.

property.value: 2 N-Linked glycans (1 site), 1 O-Linked glycan (1 site)
Transport of nucleosides and free purine and pyrimidine bases across the plasma membrane
Expressed in lower esophagus and 205 other tissues

feature.description: In a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation.
In a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs767108156.
No effect on subcellular localization and inosine transport.
No effect on subcellular localization and inosine transport.
